Title: Equinor and partners invest $1.13 billion to boost Troll gas output
Description: Equinor and its partners in Europe’s largest gas field, Troll, have decided to invest just over NOK 12 billion ($1.13 billion) in new infrastructure in the Troll West gas province to boost production further. The investment is expected to help maintain high export levels from Troll and the Kollsnes gas processing plant up to 2030.
Author: CK

Title: Petronet mulls a land-based terminal for Gopalpur LNG project, eyes completion in three years
Description: India’s state-owned Petronet is contemplating developing its planned Gopalpur LNG import facility in Odisha as a land-based terminal instead of a floating one because of the tight availability of floating storage regasification units in the market. It expects the project to be completed in three years.
Author: CK
